reviews.text: We stayed here, as many others, during a college visit to look at a couple of the colleges nearby. Its very convenient to the colleges and recommend this option. The hotel room was clean and has a nice courtyard area. I used the shared computer with printer in the lobby with no issues. The bed was comfortable. Check in was fast and convenient. We were given cookies upon our arrival. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Choice

reviews.text: Stayed March during Spring Break to visit Claremont Colleges with our son. Check in was fine swift and courteous. Room was clean and wifi in room was good, we had a room overlooking the car park which was fine, nice balcony and little if any traffic noise!. Beds were OK but lack of pillow choice meant not a great nights sleep, a/c only just worked and like most it is VERY noisey, didnt like the sliding bathroom door, but whatever.
reviews.title: Visiting Claremont Colleges

reviews.text: Biggest issue was housekeeping not once BUT twice asking to clean the room before 8.30am, the first time I said no, we would be checking out by 10am, second time I lost it and told her so, who in this world needs the room made up before 9am when you are checking out? Not good enough.

reviews.text: Convenient for us off the highway since we are stopping before we reach Seattle. Location quiet, staff friendly, rooms great, bed comfortable. If you need a spa day it's available too along with a nice restaurant on site. Will definitely stop back on our way back to Florida

I'm a Claremont Graduate University student who has since moved across the country, and I always stay here when I return for school business. You can easily get a decent price on a hotels web site (approx. $100 a night, sometimes!), and the hotel is clean and easily accessible. I've never eaten at the restaurant or bar, but you don't have to, because Claremont has a wonderful variety of establishments within walking distance. The sliding door on the bathroom is a little weird, but livable; also, the coffeemaker didn't exactly produce great brew, but there's a little coffee and smoothie bar (The Spot) around the corner that is highly recommended. Couple that with the fact that Trader Joe's is right next door, and you're set for food in a hurry. The room has a fridge, so it's easy to grab a couple of salads and sodas and settle in for work or relaxation if you wish. Highly recommended for travel to Claremont!
reviews.title: Consistently great.

reviews.text: I was impressed with all aspects of the hotel and location. The grounds are gorgeous, even in the winter. The rooms are quiet and it was an enjoyable stay. Matt did an outstanding job with the check in process and chose a wonderful room. If ever in the area again for business, i will choose this location and recommend it to others. There is a great little village with shops and restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay!

reviews.text: This is a nice hotel with everything to offer. There is a great restaurant on site serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner, as well as round the clock room service. Of course it has a pool, hot tubs, office space, ect.. In addition to the on site restaurant, there is also another great Italian restaurant, as well as a dueling piano bar, that all share a parking lot with the hotel. They also have an agreement with a local recreation center offering a full gym, saunas, pools, tennis courts, ect.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with Everything to Offer

reviews.text: The hotel staff were all incredibly nice and accommodating. Every desire was met and surpassed. I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

reviews.text: Front desk and overall service was very good, helpful and pleasant. Breakfast area staff were also relatively prompt and provided quality service. Rooms are nice with good beds and a nice work area. Good wifi access. Bathrooms are of a good size and the shower functional. The breakfast itself was definitely up to par if not better, with a nice arrangement of prepared food (scrambled eggs, potatoes, "meats", etc.), breads, cereals, oats, and of course made to order omelets and eggs.

reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.text: The Doubletree was in a good location with a variety of restaurants nearby. The rooms were nice and appeared to have been updated recently. I had reserved their "larger" king room and it was fairly large but it was what I would have expected a regular king room size to have been. It was fine for the 2 days that I was there. The bed was very comfortable and had plenty of pillows! There was a small balcony which I couldn't enjoy due to the rain that was coming down. The bathroom door had a large opaque glass inset so if you were sharing a room it left some privacy but not as much as if it had been a solid door. The bathroom itself was nice but there was no where to hang any clothes. The only place to hang anything was right at the edge of the shower. The restaurant on site was good but was on the expensive side. I found it cheaper to order off the menu than it was to get the buffet breakfast. The staff were all very pleasant. All in all I would probably stay here again.
